definition: to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
to exert oneself (bound form)
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Like the sea of science, and require desperate struggle.
sentences.chinese: 科学如同大海，要求奋不顾身的拼搏。

sentences.english: Worship is full of love and selfless love non-stop exacerbating.
sentences.chinese: 充满崇拜的爱与奋不顾身的爱不停加剧着。

sentences.english: Because that desperate love, what I lost you never know.
sentences.chinese: 由于那奋不顾身的爱，我失去了什么你不会知道。

sentences.english: At any risk, we put the boat's head direct for the landing-place.
sentences.chinese: 我们奋不顾身地将船头对准了着陆地点。

sentences.english: It is mothers that help us silently and devotedly.
sentences.chinese: 母亲，是默默给予我们帮助，为我们奋不顾身的人。

sentences.english: Now it's the " rush hour" to be repaid for that devotion for him.
sentences.chinese: 而今他的奋不顾身得到了“尖峰时刻”的回报。

sentences.english: He saved the drowning boy at the risk of his own life.
sentences.chinese: 他奋不顾身地把遇溺的男孩救了起来。

sentences.english: Love often makes personal danger, until the old men, dim.
sentences.chinese: 爱情往往让人奋不顾身，直到蔼蔼老矣。

sentences.english: He jumped into the torrent to save the boy disregarding his own life.
sentences.chinese: 他奋不顾身跳进急流去救那个男孩。

sentences.english: Looking forward to a kind of eternal, even if the scars, also.
sentences.chinese: 期待一种永恒，即使伤痕，也奋不顾身。

sentences.english: They to "righteousness" word, in order to truth can be desperate.
sentences.chinese: 他们为了“义”字，为了真理就可以奋不顾身了。

sentences.english: Eliza made her desperate retreat across the river just in the dusk of twilight.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽萨奋不顾身地逃过那条河，正是暮色苍茫时分。

definition: reckless/regardless of everything
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
to give one's life
to risk one's life
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
to advance bravely
heroic/gallant/valiant
to do everything one can/to spare no effort/to strive
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
no complaints/to have no regrets
to advance dauntlessly in wave upon wave (idiom)
brave/courageous
